comments:
Hi,

during the attempt to start a C++ application eclipse often crashs.

I use eclipse-SDK M20060921 together with CDT-4.0.0-I200609180500.
I notice these crashs very often, both with java 1.5.0_06-b05 and
1.4.2_11-b06, but noticed that  "org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.MonoReconciler" occurs in all my crash dumps. Is this useful, should I send also other logs (I get every day 3-10)?

Jens

Created an attachment (id=50815)
error log

Crash log

Very weird. It looks like it's crashing in the Java VM when trying to format the Date that is shown in the Debug View. This is deep in Sun's code so I'm not sure what we can do about it. It also looks specific to the German language properties for DateFormatZoneData_de.

I installed JRE 1.5 just a few minutes ago and only set my PATH to the new java binary. I hope there are no conflicts with the old 1.4 version? At least the paths in the log look good.

I could try an export LANG=C before I start eclipse ...

Strange, it happened again. This time I got no crash but only an exception:

(Please compare with bug #158302)

I haven't seen this error for a really long time (especially since I stopped using eclipse for a half year) and use now Eclipse 3.3 M6 (or RC0?) I20070323-1616 together with CDT 4.0.0.200705111955.

If I remember correctly I did *not* install a language pack in my current eclipse tree, but I may be wrong. At least I do not see any translated string.

There happens currently a test of language packs at IBM. I asked one German bug reporter for the pack but it is not yet published, so I cannot test it with a recent language pack ...

And another stacktrace:

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at sun.text.resources.DateFormatZoneData_de.getContents(Unknown Source)
	at sun.text.resources.DateFormatZoneData.loadLookup(Unknown Source)
	at sun.text.resources.DateFormatZoneData.handleGetObject(Unknown Source)

	at java.text.DateFormat.get(Unknown Source)
	at java.text.DateFormat.getDateTimeInstance(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.update.core.Utilities.<clinit>(Utilities.java:37)
	... 18 more

I deleted a few minutes ago another eclipse installation (3.3 M5) in a parallel directory. But since I use it no longer it should be completely unrelated ... Nevertheless I have seen this error now twice after this.

I will restart eclipse ...
Neither of these last two stack traces mentions the CDT. You have a problem with your Java VM in DateFormatZoneData_de.
